reason: Bitcoin's current surge to a two-month high, driven by short squeezes and broad altcoin strength, indicates robust bullish momentum. However, this upward movement occurs amidst a highly uncertain and complex regulatory environment, evidenced by 75 proposed amendments to the crypto bill and rescheduled hearings. This dichotomy creates a volatile landscape where strong technicals could be challenged by regulatory developments, warranting careful observation.
headlines: Senators pitch more than 75 amendments for crypto bill, including on yield, DeFi sections
Bitcoin climbs to two-month high of $96,240 as altcoins surge and shorts get squeezed
Senate Agriculture Committee reschedules its own crypto bill hearing to Jan. 27
Strive tumbles 12% as reverse stock split stumps investors despite Semler acquisition
Senate's Warren: WLFI-tied bank application should be halted until Trump divests
